pageContext.claim: “According to the @nytimes, a Russian sold phony secrets on “Trump” to the U.S. Asking price was $10 million, brought down to $1 million to be paid over time. I hope people are now seeing & understanding what is going on here. It is all now starting to come out - DRAIN THE SWAMP!”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, the Times reported that U.S. spies were in touch with this Russian individual in an effort to retrieve valuable cyber weapons stolen from the NSA. During negotiations over the cyber weapons, the Russian seller offered additional and supposedly compromising information on Trump. Although the deal was for $1 million, the U.S. ended up paying only $100,000. The Times reported that U.S. spies were interested in the cyber weapons and not the Trump information. "They saw the information [on Trump], especially the video, as the stuff of tabloid gossip pages, not intelligence collection, American officials said," the Times reported.
